job_title: Senior Network Administrator/Engineer in Riverside, CA

cons: Pay is low because the program is 100% donor supported.

review_title: Grateful for the the last three years
pros: Teen challenge gave me a safe place to make mistakes and correct them. It showed me your place where I found confidence in myself to where I could be in charge of multiple bodies on caltrans work studies. I now know how to administer correction and stay in control and safely keep my guys out of harms way.
cons: I don’t believe everyone is fit to be a leader.

job_title: Direct Care Worker in Morrow, AR
pros: This job is perfect for people working on their psychology related degree because it will provide exposure to so many situations that require the use of understanding the person cognitively, behaviorally, physiologically and spiritually. Teen Challenge gave an abundant list of things to add to my resume which has shown to be a silver bullet to several employers!
cons: None of the staff are here because of the money. You can expect to get payed anywhere from $13-$15 per hour starting out, which is not too bad if you are focused more on ministry.

pros: Not corporate, mostly laid back, small admin staff

cons: Most of the men who entered the program weren't willing to complete the 13 month program and they would end up back in their addiction or in jail and it was sad to witness.

pros:
Life changing ministry for former addicts. 
Get to help save lives
cons: None at all. I love it

pros: Great cause and good people
cons: Work load was a lot for the pay

pros: The job itself, working with the clients, was great. It was fulfilling and challenging. There was freedom and flexibility between the tasks of the shift.
cons:
The direct leadership in each house was terrible. They are in those position because they have been there long enough to be promoted. It's great because they know how MnTC works, but they do not know how to lead staff. 
MnTC also lowered the standards to graduate. This raised the graduation rate but also raised the rate of graduates who relapse. There are also occasional overdoses of past clients which is difficult but comes with the territory. 
There is not much support for graduates who do not go to TCLI, which is a sort of "transitional housing" Teen Challenge offers as a ministry school. If clients don't go there they are often left to there own devices.
There is also a poverty mindset through the organization. I requested a monitor stand for the shared office. It was $25, but that was too much money.

review_title: Working at Teen Challenge was one of the most fulfilling times of my life.
pros: Teen Challenge is a Christian residential drug recovery program that is part of a network of 10 Teen Challenge centers across New England and New Jersey.The program has a strong faith-based approach and offers spiritual, academic, and vocational training that equips individuals to return to society as responsible citizens. A number of our graduates have experienced complete recovery from drug and alcohol addiction. They have told us that the key to their success was developing a personal relationship with God and putting into practice all that they had learned while in our program. While working here I got to see so many lives and families saved and restored.
cons: The pay isn't the best and the hours can be long at some times. Often you will be working in the inner city around some rough places.

review_title: My experience was life-changing and very beneficial.
pros: It is a great opportunity to  work with people in need.  It is a good venue to learn time management and teamwork.  They are good about providing support for staff during trying personal experiences.  Time off is available for  extenuating circumstances, and staff receive a 1-2 week vacation each year depending on seniority.  Training takes place continuously as needed for all employees.  Teen  Challenge makes sure that all staff participate in continuing education and personal development in all areas.
cons: The organization is usually stretched to the limit like most non-profits.  Leadership is strong, and individuals are prepared for advancement through continuing education and personal growth workshops and seminars.  Compensation is on a par with other non-profits doing similar work.

review_title: You have to be *called* to work here
pros: Working for Teen Challenge was definitely fulfilling.  I had the opportunity to watch men who struggled for most of their teen and adult life with addictions of all sorts grow into fully actualized men with a strong faith.  Watching the men grow through their struggles and overcome their addictions was definitely worthwhile.
cons: Life balance can be difficult to obtain and maintain.  It is not uncommon to have to wear multiple hats, and it is not uncommon to have to spend a considerable amount of time and energy outside the workplace—Teen Challenge *is* a Christian ministry, after all.  In short, if you find you aren't called to this sort of work, then you'll be needing to find a different career choice.

pros:
interaction with fun, upbeat, teen girls, 
wonderful, down-to-earth boss and supervisor
volunteers who spoil staff and the students
experience working with challenges that most do not encounter on an average day
cons:
long hours without more than a half an hour break
very high turnover of students and staff
pay was below average and not enough for someone to support family on

pros: Great work environment and office space for the administrative staff downtown. Most people are really nice and easy to get a long with. Free lunch is provided though it is not the healthiest food in general, salads are also offered.
cons:
Some management is a little out of touch with the common worker. 
Poor medical benefits with an extremely high deductible.
Some staff are very loud and distracting in a cubicle environment. I wouldn't normally mention this, but it's abnormally bad in some cases with management ignoring the situation.

pros: Hands down best place to work! I couldn't imagine a more caring work environment. The people here are like a second family, and everyone I know genuinely cares about their job and the impact they are making on society.
cons: You have to accept a slightly smaller salary due to it being in the nonprofit sector, but it is well worth if for what I get out of my job!

pros: Helping others, going on activities and outings, flexible, Christian activities, learning opportunities, management works with you
cons: clients can treat you poorly and be verbally abusive, high expectations, low pay for industry standard, emotionally demanding, stressful, many other employees are past clients- this can create division and these employees do not have good work/personal life boundaries- the organization is their life

pros: Teen Challenge offers hope to those in need due to life controlling issues. The company helps men and woman become self sufficient in daily life. They offered growth opportunity while training.
cons: Very demanding job dealing with individuals that struggle with life contrilling issues. Limited advancement in each town burt many centers if willing to relocate. Mostly hiring within.

pros: Teen Challenge New England has come leaps and bounds over the last few years (this was written July 2016) and I can't say enough about the direction we are heading. I have been with Teen Challenge for over 5 years, and the improvement I have seen has been incredible. New doors are opening and it provides opportunity to grow spiritually and administratively. Highly recommend.
cons: All cons are constantly being evaluated with the leadership. Nothing to complain about.

pros: MNTC is very committed to its mission of helping people with substance abuse problems in a faith based context.
cons: This is a ministry and a business.  The focus on people and giving grace collide with standard business practices resulting in blurry boundaries and inconsistent treatment of employees.  There are some excellent and talented leaders but the number of locations results in different experiences in each building.   Advancement opportunities are limited in most areas as the organization is fairly flat.

pros: Helps you to help others. Turns lives around and builds a family of friends.
cons: Can become a hide out for those not willing to live in the world.

pros: Free lunches. Plus the company has generally good intentions in terms of helping people.
cons: Poor management, at least in the Accounting Department. Little to no competition with salary or benefits. Not much PTO. Lack of professionalism in the workplace.

pros: Seeing the girls grow and change was encouraging and awesome. Spending the time mentoring them and teaching them also helped me grow.
cons: The leadership needed some growth. There were numerous areas where there was a double-standard and it was obvious to the teens we worked with, it left support staff unable to fully enforce some rules.

pros: Strong commitment to faith based principles, opportunities for growth and experience. Solid leadership at the local level.
cons: Questionable leadership at the regional level. Long hours, sometimes expected to work above and beyond because it is "ministry".

review_title: Teen Challenge Monterey Bay Christian Discipleship Program
job_title: Education Coordinator in Royal Oaks, CA
pros: Being able to be apart of men and women changing there lives is priceless.
cons: It is not glamorous. We share the facility with the Pajaro Rescue Mission. But if you can accept the rough exterior you will be surprised the treasure it holds .

pros: MNTC is a great place to work.  The culture there is one of unity, cooperation and opportunities for growth.  The organization continues to improve in areas of IT, HR and being best in class in the industry.
cons: As with many non-profits staff wear many hats and often there is pressure to accomplish things outside of the job description.

review_title: The best of times. The worst of times.
pros: Very good mission.  Excellent neighborhood in Brooklyn.  The staff was kind.  There were a lot of people to help. Well known organization.
cons: A lot.  Staff underpaid and undertrained.  Food very poor quality.  Housing and office buildings were in poor condition.  No one got to know the neighbors.  Most people just remain on campus.

review_title: Long hours for a great cause
pros: It is wonderful to do what you love for work. Helping others grow and thrive as they walk through the journey of overcoming addiction is incredible.
cons: Long hours, large toll on emotional health and well being.

pros: Teen Challenge is a faith based ministry that helps women with life controlling issues such as substance abuse and eating disorders be able to overcome these problems through a relationship with Christ

review_title: My experience at Teen Challenge has been a learning experience.
